| **[Reference](/wiki/Source_code "Source code")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          | [dNetHack 3.21.1 monst.c, line 1257](https://github.com/Chris-plus-alphanumericgibberish/dNAO/blob/compat-3.21.1/src/monst.c#L1257)                                                                             |

A **swamp nymph** is a type of [monster](/wiki/Monster "Monster") that appears in [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack") and [notdNetHack](/wiki/NotdNetHack "NotdNetHack"). It is an [undead](/wiki/Undead "Undead") [nymph](/wiki/Nymph_\(monster_class\) "Nymph (monster class)") that is the strongest type of nymph any player character can encounter randomly: stronger monsters in the [monster class](/wiki/Monster_class "Monster class") only appear to specific roles. Swamp nymphs are part-[plant](/wiki/Plant_\(dNetHack\) "Plant (dNetHack)"), and like many nymphs they are [fey creatures](/wiki/Fey_\(dNetHack\) "Fey (dNetHack)").

Swamp nymphs [cast spells](/wiki/Monster_spell "Monster spell") in addition to stealing items, and sometimes retaliate by "collapsing into a noxious fluid" when badly wounded in melee. This kills the the swamp nymph immediately, but will inflict [disease](/wiki/Disease "Disease") on the attacker.

## Generation

Swamp nymphs are only randomly generated in [Gehennom](/wiki/Gehennom "Gehennom"), though they may appear in the courts of a [throne room](/wiki/Special_room_\(dNetHack\)#Throne_room_.28throne_occupied.29 "Special room (dNetHack)") ruled by a [vampire lord](/wiki/Vampire_lord "Vampire lord") or [drow matron](/wiki/Drow_matron "Drow matron").

At least one swamp nymph is guaranteed to appear in the lair of [Zuggtmoy](/wiki/Zuggtmoy "Zuggtmoy"), and two swamp nymphs named Surrarr and Nueate appear within rooms on each side of [Mammon](/wiki/Mammon "Mammon")'s throne room in Minauros. In one variation each of the lairs of [Malcanthet](/wiki/Malcanthet "Malcanthet") and [Graz'zt](/wiki/Graz%27zt "Graz'zt"), the random nymphs that can generate upon their creation are always swamp nymphs due to generation rules.

## Strategy

Swamp nymphs are the most difficult regular enemy in their monster class by far, especially if one manages to steal your source of [magic resistance](/wiki/Magic_resistance "Magic resistance").

## Encyclopedia entry

As a forest pathogen, a fungus can be very destructive. Its high destructiveness comes from the fact that, unlike most parasites, it doesn't need to moderate its growth in order to avoid killing its host, since it will continue to thrive on the dead material.

\[ Adapted from Wikipedia ]

[![This article describes a 3.4.3-based variant of NetHack. Click here for more information.](/images/5/5d/Nh343var-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article describes a 3.4.3-based variant of NetHack. Click here for more information.")

Swamp nymph

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
n swamp nymph
Difficulty 14
Attacks Claw 0d0 steal item, Claw 0d0 seduction, Cast 1d8 mage spell, Passive 0d0 disease
n swamp nymph
Difficulty 14
Attacks

Claw 0d0 steal item, Claw 0d0 seduction, Cast 1d8 mage spell, Passive 0d0 disease

Base level 9
Base experience 203
Speed 12
Base AC 0
Base MR 70
Alignment −10 (chaotic)
Frequency (by normal means) 2 (Quite rare)
Genocidable No
Weight 600
Nutritional value 300
Size medium

A swamp nymph:

  • has a head, a couple of arms, and a torso.
  • can teleport.
  • is omnivorous.
  • is undead.
  • is female.
  • is normally generated hostile.
  • can pick up weapons and food.
  • can be seen through infravision.
  • appears only in Gehennom.
  • can leave an old 1 corpse.
  • resists death magic.
  • cannot be tamed.
  • does not naturally regenerate HP.
Reference dNetHack 3.21.1 monst.c, line 1257

A swamp nymph is a type of monster that appears in dNetHack and notdNetHack. It is an undead nymph that is the strongest type of nymph any player character can encounter randomly: stronger monsters in the monster class only appear to specific roles. Swamp nymphs are part-plant, and like many nymphs they are fey creatures.

Swamp nymphs cast spells in addition to stealing items, and sometimes retaliate by "collapsing into a noxious fluid" when badly wounded in melee. This kills the the swamp nymph immediately, but will inflict disease on the attacker.

Generation

Swamp nymphs are only randomly generated in Gehennom, though they may appear in the courts of a throne room ruled by a vampire lord or drow matron.

At least one swamp nymph is guaranteed to appear in the lair of Zuggtmoy, and two swamp nymphs named Surrarr and Nueate appear within rooms on each side of Mammon's throne room in Minauros. In one variation each of the lairs of Malcanthet and Graz'zt, the random nymphs that can generate upon their creation are always swamp nymphs due to generation rules.

Strategy

Swamp nymphs are the most difficult regular enemy in their monster class by far, especially if one manages to steal your source of magic resistance.

Encyclopedia entry

As a forest pathogen, a fungus can be very destructive. Its high destructiveness comes from the fact that, unlike most parasites, it doesn't need to moderate its growth in order to avoid killing its host, since it will continue to thrive on the dead material.

[ Adapted from Wikipedia ]

A '''swamp nymph''' is a type of [[monster]] that appears in [[dNetHack]] and [[notdNetHack]]. It is an [[undead]] [[nymph (monster class)|nymph]] that is the strongest type of nymph any player character can encounter randomly: stronger monsters in the [[monster class]] only appear to specific roles. Swamp nymphs are part-[[Plant (dNetHack)|plant]], and like many nymphs they are [[Fey (dNetHack)|fey creatures]].

Swamp nymphs [[Monster spell|cast spells]] in addition to stealing items, and sometimes retaliate by "collapsing into a noxious fluid" when badly wounded in melee. This kills the the swamp nymph immediately, but will inflict [[disease]] on the attacker.

==Generation==
Swamp nymphs are only randomly generated in [[Gehennom]], though they may appear in the courts of a [[Special room (dNetHack)#Throne room (throne occupied)|throne room]] ruled by a [[vampire lord]] or [[drow matron]].

At least one swamp nymph is guaranteed to appear in the lair of [[Zuggtmoy]], and two swamp nymphs named Surrarr and Nueate appear within rooms on each side of [[Mammon]]'s throne room in Minauros. In one variation each of the lairs of [[Malcanthet]] and [[Graz'zt]], the random nymphs that can generate upon their creation are always swamp nymphs due to generation rules.

==Strategy==
Swamp nymphs are the most difficult regular enemy in their monster class by far, especially if one manages to steal your source of [[magic resistance]].
